title: Share of students of primary school age achieving minimum proficiency, by subject
subtitle: The share of children who achieve minimum proficiency by the end of [primary](#dod:primary-education) education. For [math](#dod:math-proficiency), students can demonstrate skills in number sense and computation, basic measurement, reading, interpreting, and constructing graphs, spatial orientation, and number patterns. For [reading](#dod:reading-proficiency), children can identify key ideas in texts and connect them to their own experiences.
